Button Groups

Button groups are groups of connected buttons that can act either as radio buttons or checkboxes.

Examples

${require('html-loader?interpolate!../../partials/toggles.html')}

Checkbox Group

Use a checkbox group when users should be able to select none, one, or multiple options.

Radio Group

Use a radio group when users should only be able to select one of the available options.

Guidelines

  • Ensure button titles are short. If option labels are long, use a list of radio buttons or checkboxes instead.
  • When vertical space for a list of options is limited, consider using a button group to better utilize horizontal space. For example, a checkbox button group for filters, or a radio button group to switch between screen views.
  • Consider using a button group when mobile usability is a priority, since they provide larger touch targets than radio buttons or checkboxes.
